ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
R = Right; L = Left; B = Both; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Ascending value before participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 1
Ascending value after participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 1
Ascending value before participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 2
Ascending value after participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 2
Descending value before participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 1
Descending value after participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 1
Descending value before participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 2
Descending value after participant's first confirmation of feeling of touch in block 2
Number of positive catch responses (i.e. saying "yes, I felt something" when no stimuli present)
